The Punnett square for two independent genes:

          | C    | c
----------|-------|---
        C | CC  | Cc
        c | Cc  | cc

But since we have two loci (C and B), the Punnett square becomes a 4x4 grid:

          | B    | b
----------|-------|---
        B | BB  | Bb
        b | Bb  | bb

Each combination of C and B from the parents results in specific phenotypes based on dominance.
